Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four injure private firm staffer, rob ba.description: PUNE: Four men brutally attacked an employee of a private firm with a sharp weapon and robbed his bag containing Rs3 lakh near the Pune Municipal Corporation’s Sangamwadi ward office around 1.30pm on Friday. Sudhakar Kshisagar (35), from Yerawada, received injuries behind his right ear, and suffered minor abrasions on his hands. Kshirsagar works in a firm jointly run by three businessmen involved in selling mobile recharge cards, among other things. Inspector (crime) Ajay Waghmare from Yerawada police said, “Kshirsagar collected Rs3 lakh cash from businessmen till about 1pm. Riding a motorcycle, he crossed Gunjan Chowk and was heading towards Parnakuti Chowk, when a man suddenly came in front of his bike, which prompted Kshirsagar to apply the brakes. The man then picked up a dispute with him, and signalled three others to come there.” He said, “The four then attacked Kshirsagar and one of them assaulted him with a sharp weapon behind his right ear. The other suspect snatched his bag. Two suspects then fled barefoot in the direction of Parnakuti Chowk, while two others ran towards the construction site of Metro project on Ahmednagar road.” “After Kshirsagar raised an alarm, a passer-by came to his rescue. He called up the city police control room and gave information about the incident. A police team rushed to the spot and shifted him to Sassoon General Hospital. We are checking CCTV cameras and working on certain clues to arrest the robbers as soon as possible,” he added. A police official said, “The robbers communicated in Marathi. They were in the age group of 20-22 years. We suspect the robbery was pre-planned. The suspects robbed Kshirsagar after monitoring his movements.” Kshirsagar has lodged an FIR under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Arms Act. India to assist international consortium.description: PUNE: For the past four years, Giant Metrewave Radio Telescope (GMRT), near Pune, and Ooty Radio Telescope have been conducting experiments in pulsar timing and keeping a database of the same. With the 10th annual meeting of International Pulsar Timing Array Collaboration being hosted in Pune next week, India is hoping to soon become a permanent member of International Pulsar Timing Array Collaboration. Pulsar is a highly magnetized rotating celestial object of very high mass that emits a beam of electromagnetic radiation. “The radiation can be seen when it points towards the earth as pulses of emission, which appear with clockwork precision. Hence, they are the best celestial clocks,” said Gopakumar, senior scientist, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR), Mumbai “Now, if there is a gravitational wave passing past the pulsar, there will be a blip or difference in the otherwise disciplined pulses. By studying this variation over a period of time, we can determine a pattern in it. This pattern will tell us about the gravitational waves. Now gravitational waves are like waves with a ripple effect just like the ripple effect we see when a pebble is dropped in a pond. Instead of the up and down motion, the G waves are like sound waves; they expand and compress,” said Mavia McLaughlin, professor of physics and astronomy, West Virginia University, the US. The team has been collecting data on the arrival time of pulsars. “More the data on arrival time of pulsars, more we can understand if there is a pattern of change in them and the cause. So data collection and analysis of pulsars are being done by the Indian team,” said Andrea Lommen, professor of astronomy and physics, Haverford College, the US. The group is hoping to detect a gravitational wave of ultra-low frequency but other than that they said that their research will have by-product discoveries too. “From accuracy in understanding the position of the sun to understanding how early galaxies were formed, how they expand and also how they merge, there will be a lot of by-product research result to the G Wave result,” said B C Joshi, senior scientist, National Centre for Radio Astrophysics (NCRA). The experiments started in 2001 and India is trying to be a permanent member of this project involving 12 countries. “The upgraded GMRT is able to analyse at least three bands of frequencies. We have been collecting data for the past four years and now we have approached the international group with a deliverable data which, hopefully, will also lead to a membership,” said Yashwant Gupta, centre director, NCRA. New plants to process 400MT garbage dail.description: PUNE: The civic body’s daily garbage-processing capacity will soon increase by 400 metric tonnes (MT). The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), as a part of its plan to decentralize garbage-handling and stop dumping of unprocessed garbage at the Uruli depot before December 2019, will set up two 100MT plants and one 200MT plant. The 100MT plants will be set up at Ambegaon and Lohegaon, while the 200MT plant will come up at Uruli Devachi to process mixed garbage. The civic body will appoint private agencies to install, commission, operate, and maintain the plants. The sites for the site have already been identified, while sources in the civic body said the agencies will be appointed by next month. With processing mixed garbage a challenge, PMC had instructed housing societies, commercial establishments and hotels to treat wet garbage on their premises. But most of the new plants would be able to handle mixed garbage, officials said. “New plants will be set up in the fringes to deal with waste in effectively. Besides the newly proposed units, the civic body has already started work on a 750-tonne plant at Ramtekdi-Hadapsar,” a senior official from the solid waste management department said. Civic activists, meanwhile, claimed the PMC often plans to set up new processing units but neglects existing ones. They claimed many units across the city have been non-functional or working below half their capacities. Data obtained through an RTI petition, filed by Vivek Velankar of Sajag Nagrik Manch, revealed that the PMC was not able to operate the units at full capacity. “The PMC should ensure better functioning of the existing processing units,” Velankar said. Pune city generates about 2,000 tonnes of garbage every day. Of this, the civic body processes over 1,000 tonnes. Meanwhile, about 500 tonnes of waste is generated by the 11 newly merged villages, where the mechanism to process garbage daily is less than optimal. Puneites over the moon as Men in Blue be.description: PUNE: It may have been an anticlimactic win in the end — thanks to Messrs Duckworth, Lewis and Stern — but India’s World Cup victory over arch-rivals Pakistan was nevertheless cherished by cricket fans in the city. By the time both the teams shook hands in Manchester, India had beaten Pakistan in each of the seven times they met in World Cups. And fans came out in force to celebrate. The stretch of Fergusson College Road, near Dnyaneshwar Paduka Chowk, was chock-a-block with jubilant fans. Drummers dished out a pulsating rhythm as revellers relished the Men in Blue’s performance. For many families in the city, it was an evening filled with entertainment. When all-rounder Hardik Pandya bowled a full toss to Pakistan’s Babar Azam, who dispatched it for four, the Nigavekars gasped. Their youngest son, Jay (9), was decked up in Indian colours as the family were glued to the television. “My son and daughter are crazy about the game, so they’re completely into the match right now,” said Pallavi. The mood in the city was upbeat, with fans setting off fireworks as early as 8.30pm in the Deccan area, as people got ready to celebrate India’s imminent victory. “I’m super excited. I’m so pumped up,” young Jay said. “It’s doubly special ... it’s also Father’s Day,” the nine-year-old added. His father Kedar, a health care professional based in Mumbai, agreed it was a special occasion. “My son is a big cricket fan — he wears the Indian team jersey every day ... It’s been crazy!” Kedar said. The mood was electric at eateries and malls across the city, which organized live screenings of the match. Rahul Kusale, manager of Vimannagar-based Playoffs Sports Lounge, said they had a full house. “We attracted a very good crowd,” Kusale said, adding that it was great to see that the audience watching the match with complete thrill. “The way they react collectively is something else. There were loud cheers for boundaries and sixes. The fans were egging the team on with a lot of enthusiasm,” Kusale said. Nanded-based Priyanka Vyas (25), who stays on Senapati Bapat Road, made a beeline for the nearest mall with her friend Achint Kaur, an IT professional, for live screening alongside multitudes of fans. “Around 200 people turned up to watch the game on the big screen,” Vyas said. However, the constant rain interruptions cast a pall of gloom over the match. “On the one hand, I was disappointed that the rain kept interfering with the match, but on the other, I was happy that India won,” Prashant Gaikwad (22), an engineering student, said. “Our initial expectation was that India would win fair and square, and though that happened, it was annoying because of the rain,” Gaikwad said. “I’m at my aunt’s place and I could hear loud cheers from the entire building,” he said. However, the roads congested with celebrating fans were a reason to frown, for some. Arya Bhavnani (34), who stays in Bavdhan, couldn’t wait to get home. “I’m happy that we won, but it’s annoying that this stretch always gets congested on such occasions,” Bhavnani said. \nSunny Leone attends the launch of Play.description: PB Lifestyle Ltd, the master and exclusive license holder in India for Playboy Enterprises Inc, USA has unveiled its plans for 2016. The company’s license includes Playboy-branded clubs, cafes, lounges and pubs, beer gardens, hotels, signature events and merchandise. The company will be rolling out its outlets under the Playboy umbrella brand comprising clubs — international formats that India hasn’t yet experienced. After opening its first club in Hyderabad and beach club in Goa, the flagship club will open in Mumbai in April 2016. Located at Worli, it promises to raise the bar of parallel formats in India.  “Playboy India is also creating history with the launch of its first Beer Garden in the world in Pune. We are designing a fantastic fusion of fine dining, entertainment, music and freshly brewed beer,” says Parag Sanghavi (Chairman, PB Lifestyle).  With an exciting launch party, Pune came alive as Sunny Leone turned deejay for a while playing catchy tunes for guests, which included Pooja Chopra, Meera Chopra, Suhas (brand partner, Pune), Krishan Choudhary (brand partner, North), Ranjeet Kagade (brand partner, Pune) and several others. Located in Balewadi High Street, it is spread over 8,000 square feet and offers an extensive outdoor area attached to a luxurious indoor space, making it an ideal place to enjoy food and beverages with live music and events. The garden offers the communal Oktoberfest beer benches, chiller tables and luxury seating that can collectively accommodate over 400 guests. It serves food from around the world with modern European; Asian grills, gourmet pizzas and a fresh take on Indian cuisine as well as the signature Hef-Burger.  “While we are a Beer Garden, we have paid extra attention to curating the perfect and comprehensive food menu by bringing in the champions from the F&B industry,” explains Ranjeet.  The brand will open a 12,000 sq ft Beer Garden in Bangalore in the third quarter of 2016. The first cafe will open in Gurgaon (NCR), followed by one in Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad — both slated for opening in the second quarter of 2016. “Delhi is truly looking forward to experiencing the brand’s hospitality,” says Krishan. Half-an-hour lunch break for Maharashtra.description: PUNE: The state government employees will now on have a fixed lunch break of half-an-hour between 1pm and 2pm and won’t be permitted to waste time thereafter. A new government resolution (GR) was issued this month following rising complaints about officials not attending to citizens properly. The GR iterates that the government officials must maintain strict adherence to the timing. All employees from a department cannot go for lunch at the same time. The June 4 circular stated, “Office heads should ensure that officers/staffers will not take more time (than the stipulated 30 minutes) for lunch and that all the officers/staffers in a branch do not go for lunch at the same time.” According to the circular, the slot has been fixed in view of complaints that officers and staffers stay away from their desks for long citing lunch break, leaving citizens waiting in queues. Worse, many officials excuse themselves for meetings soon after returning to their desks. The heads of departments have been directed to implement the new order and take disciplinary action against those absent after the stipulated lunch interval without permission, stated an official. Fixed lunch interval was one of the recommendations of the high-level reorganization committee appointed by the government. Some other recommendations, including reduction in the number of holidays in a year, were implemented earlier. Citizens want the 30-minute lunch break to be implemented in the state government offices strictly. The programme director of Parisar, an environmental organization, Ranjit Gadgil, told TOI that the move was good, but it should be implemented properly. “The officers have to adhere to these norms and citizens should not be made to wait and suffer,” he said. Activist Vihar Durve himself had to wait for long at Mantralaya earlier because of the “extended lunch” of officials. Hailing the decrease in the lunch break timing, he said the focus should be on concerted effort to clear the files at the earliest. “There is no point in just reducing the lunch time if they delay the process of clearing files or refuse to meet citizens,” he added. In September 2001, the state government had fixed half-an-hour slot between 1pm and 2pm for its officials at Mantralaya (state secretariat) in Mumbai. But the government had not fixed the lunch time for other offices in the state. “This is a step further and will limit the recess of all officers and staffers in the state government departments,” stated a revenue department official from the Pune division. Autorickshaw unions on indefinite stir f.description: PUNE: Autorickshaw drivers in the city may go off the roads from July 9, indefinitely. “There are around 30 autorickshaw unions in Pune. On Sunday, there was a meeting and a majority of their representatives participated in it and decided to support the indefinite strike from July 9 across the state. There are close to 80,000 autorickshaws Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad and a majority of them will go off the roads unless the state government agrees to our demands,” Baba Kamble, secretary of the Autorickshaw Chalak Malak Sanghatna Sanyukta Kriti Samiti, told TOI. While the strike could cripple public transportation, the Rickshaw Panchayat, which is the largest union in the city, has decided to stay out. Its convenor Nitin Pawar said, “We don’t think that the strike will happen at all. Half the 80,000-odd autorickshaws are under our union,” he said. The primary demand is for a fare hike of Rs 4 per km. There has been no rise in fares in the last three years. They want the state government to set up a welfare board. The amount taken for third party insurance for the vehicles needs to be reduced, they added. A meeting with the chief minister and the transport minister on June 30 has been planned. Pune: Crooks offer man\u2019s daughter T.description: PUNE: The Kondhwa police on Thursday booked two fraudsters for duping an Undri resident of Rs55,000 by offering his 12-year-old daughter a role on a television show. The incident happened between May 22 and 25 this year. Police said one suspect sent a message to the complainant’s wife on social media, stating that they wanted a girl between 10 and 12 years old for a role in a serial to be telecast on a leading TV channel on May 22. When she sought more details, the suspect share a mobile number. The following day, she contacted the number and spoke to the other suspect. She shared her daughter’s photographs and profile after obtaining more details about the TV serial. The suspect called her later, informing her that the girl’s profile got selected and told the woman to visit Mumbai to finalize the details, police said. The woman then contacted her husband, a PWD consultant, who was in Aurangabad, and gave him the suspect’s phone number. The man called the suspect and agreed to visit Mumbai to sign a contract. On the conman’s behest, the consultant transferred Rs25,000 and Rs30,000 into their bank account and went to Mumbai. The suspects called him to two places, including a film studio in Juhu, but avoided meeting him in person. Further, the suspects began avoiding the complainant on one excuse or the other, before he stopped taking the man’s calls altogether. He also did not refund the money to the consultant, police said. Realizing that he was cheated, the consultant filed a complaint application with the cyber police station, which in turn referred the application to the Kondhwa police for further action. On Thursday, the police recorded his statement and registered an FIR under relevant sections of the IPC and the IT Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

35,000 NSS students to join wari for soc.description: PUNE: About 21,000 National Service Scheme volunteers from colleges and institutes affiliated to Savitribai Phule Pune University will participate in the annual palkhi procession from Dehu and Alandi to Pandharpur. About 14,000 students from other universities will also work alongside, taking the number to 35,000. Students from Shivaji University, Kolhapur, Punyashlok Ahilyabai Holkar Solapur University, SNDT University and Maharashtra University for Health Science will join them. The initiative will be held from June 22 to July 15. SPPU will also attempt a Guinness Record for the distribution of the highest number of saplings. “At present, the number is 9,400. The university will distribute about 20,000 saplings,” a university official said. “Walking with the wari makes students not just participate in socially productive work, but also gives them an experience of a tradition practised for hundreds of years,” vice chancellor Nitin Karmalkar said at a news conference on Friday. On June 23, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis will attend the sapling distribution programme. They will be planted on the premises of various colleges not necessarily along the wari route , a university official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. In Video:On cam: Sikh driver, his son beaten, dragged and kicked on road by Delhi PoliceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

"Another strike on Pakistan by team India and the result is the same. Congratulations to the entire team for this superb performance. Every Indian is feeling proud and celebrating this impressive win," Shah said in a tweet. Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same. Leaders cutting across party lines wished team India for its performance in what was seen as a prestige battle. We hope that you will bring honour to the country by winning the World Cup. We are proud of Team India," he tweeted in Hindi. Pune: Man dupes woman of Rs 46k in onlin.description: PUNE: A man was booked on Saturday for duping a 22-year-old woman of Rs46,200 on the pretext of offering her job at a private airline’s office at the Pune airport between April 22 and May 2, 2019. The woman, from Mumbai, has lodged an FIR with the Pimpri police under section 420 (cheating) of the Indian Penal Code. Sub-inspector Vilas Palande said, “The woman was searching for a job online when the suspect contacted her and offered her a job. He told her to transfer varied amounts for verification, issuing a confirmation letter and for purchasing the airline company’s uniform.” The woman collectively transferred about Rs46,200 to the account of a public sector bank. “The man then asked her to pay Rs1,500 as cab fare to the company’s office. This triggered suspicion and the woman refused. She then visited the airline’s office and realized that she had been duped,” Palande said “She approached the police after the suspect's cellphone number was out of reach,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Census pre-test in state\u2019s three di.description: PUNE: Pre-test of Census 2021 will be carried out in the state’s three districts as a precursor to the 2021 census. With the pre-test operation of the entire process proposed to be conducted all over India in select sample units during August and September, census office sources told TOI that three districts in Maharashtra, having both rural and urban population, will be covered and the sample size of the population will be decided soon. However, the districts where the pre-test will be carried out have not been disclosed . A workshop was held in Pune from June 3-11 with master trainers conducting field trials in select areas in Pune district. Senior officials from the state census department said headmasters and teachers will be roped in for the project. The national trainers were trained last month and they are now training master trainers from Maharashtra, Gujarat, Telangan and Goa. They will then train the field functionaries for the pre-test, the officials added. Senior officials said the pre-test will have to be carried out with care in order to finalise the instruments, method and processing of the actual census. The pre-test of census will be extremely challenging as digital mode of data collection will be tested in the field for the first time. This will ensure timely publication of census data. For the Census 2021, enumerators will no longer need to carry voluminous paper to record data, with the Registrar General of India (RGI) and Census Commissioner working on a mobile application that will help them capture data on their respective phones. This will eliminate the laborious process of electronic data entries, besides making compilation of data easier and faster, stated an official. This is for the first time in the 140-year history of the census that the data will be collected through mobile app. Enumerators will be paid appropriate remuneration for using their own mobile devices to record census data, officials said. They will also have the option of collecting data through the usual paper work. However, they will have to submit all the data electronically. The Census 2021 is the world’s largest enumeration exercise as per the home ministry. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No representation for Pune as Dilip Kamb.description: PUNE: Sunday’s state cabinet expansion has come as good news for Maval but brought dismay for Pune. The city which sent eight BJP MLAs to the assembly and had two ministers till recently will now be deprived of any ministerial representation. Dilip Kamble, the only ministerial representative from Pune, was dropped in the reshuffle effected on Sunday. Kamble, who represents Pune Cantonment assembly constituency, was the minister of state for social justice and special assistance. The other minister, Girish Bapat, who was elected as Member of Parliament recently, resigned from the state assembly. He was the minister for food, civil supplies and consumer protection, food and drugs administration, parliamentary affairs in the Devendra Fadnavis government. “I was among the first 10 state ministers who took oath as soon as the government was formed in 2014. I am happy with my tenure and grateful to the party and the chief minister for the opportunity to work as a minister,” Kamble told TOI on Sunday. During his tenure, he took some landmark decisions that will help youngsters from the deprived classes in the long run, he said. They include ease of providing caste certificates, scholarships for international studies and building hostels for needy students. The minister had courted controversy over some remarks which he had later backtracked after public anger swelled. He was embroiled in an alleged case of corruption. The police, acting on directives from the court, had registered a case against him and four others for allegedly cheating a trader by promising him two liquor shop licences. Kamble said controversies would happen with people in public life and he has moved on. He added that he would come out clean. The opposition parties have expressed surprise over leaving out Pune without minister to represent it. The BJP on the other hand claimed that the cabinet changes will not adversely impact the city’s development. “Pune is the second biggest city after Mumbai and not having a single minister is strange. Such a big metropolis must have a ministerial representative. It helps in putting forward the issues of the city and generating funds for development works,” Ramesh Bagwe, city unit chief of Congress and former state minister, said. Several BJP leaders in the city said the reshuffle and the absence of any representative from Pune will not affect the development projects in the city. “The decision to make changes in the state cabinet is taken at the chief minister’s office level. They must have thought out a policy and made some calculations before taking the call. The changes will not create any obstacle in the decision-making process for city. It will also not hamper development works,” Yogesh Gogawale, city unit chief of BJP, said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man dies, two others hurt as bikes colli.description: PUNE: A 28-year-old man from Bhor was killed and two others including a minor boy sustained injuries, after their motorcycles collided head-on, in the Bopdev Ghat section on Saturday night. The deceased was identified as Rupesh Shilimkar (28) of Bhor. The injured — Ganesh Kiwale (23) of Purandar and his nephew Saurabh Jagdale (13) — are being treated in a private hospital. None of them were wearing helmets. An officer from the Kondhwa police said Kiwale and Jadgale were returning home after closing the former’s stationery shop and Shilimkar was going towards Khadi Machine Chowk via Bopdev Ghat. “Their motorcycles collided head-on near a private college in the ghat section,” the officer said. The three of them fell off and Shilimkar died on the spot. “We have booked Kiwale for negligent driving,” the officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nMusic, food and entertainment enchant.description: Music and gastronomy, combined with a bevy of stars and cuisines, created a unique extravaganza that made Puneites come together. Youngsters were enthralled with not only the music but the breath of cuisines available from the Gourmet Renaissance master brand. Meru Kapital, the promoters of Gourmet Renaissance, an emerging food and beverage conglomerate with interests in catering, specialty restaurants and eat-in services, took their love affair with Pune further ahead this time, after winning hearts with their philosophy of ‘Love, Serve and Care’ at the RPSG matches in the city.  After winning hearts with their products, services and philosophy of Love, Serve and Care at the RPSG matches in Pune, Meru Kapital, the promoters of Gourmet Renaissance — an emerging food and beverage conglomerate with interests in catering, specialty restaurants and eat-in services — presented the Pune Music Festival. The festival was headlined by Himesh Reshammiya, along with a line-up of bands like Parikrama, Indian Ocean, Euphoria, Lost Stories, Agnee, Raghu Dixit Project and deejays such as Ankytrixx, Ritviz and Naezy.  Eleven specialty restaurant brands of Gourmet Renaissance provided an array of international cuisine in a pop-up format that created a food festival-like experience at the venue. Gourmet Renaissance brands such as Thai Baan, Viva Latino, Zonkos, Maadjapahit, Mesopotamia, Mughlai Rasoi and Villiagio Italiano created a buzz with Puneites. Pop ups included cuisines ranging from Indonesian, Thai, Latin American, British, Mediterranean, Italian, Afghani, Asian and Indian, providing an eclectic range to festival goers.  Prannay Raj Malhotra, a visitor at the festival, said, “I came to enjoy hard rock music but ended up enjoying the scrumptious molecular gastronomy!” Christina Bharwani (Director, Gourmet Renaissance) lit the lamp with Himesh Reshammiya to launch the festival. She said, “We thank the Magar family for arranging this exciting musical line-up and bringing them to Pune. We promise to bring many more national and international celebrities to Pune on a regular basis. Our brand is committed to a vibrant Pune, and taking forward our Love Serve Care philosophy. We are delighted to collaborate with Himesh, who has more than 650 hits to his name, to compose an anthem for us on this theme. We feel his songs are soul stirring and look forward to this association.”  Said Himesh, “The values of Love Serve Care are eternal. I am glad to collaborate with the brand by composing an anthem on these core values.” The company also announced the opening of Bollywood Rendezvous, a musical lounge that will offer a mélange of food and entertainment with a menu inspired by Bollywood hit songs — from the golden melodies of Lata Mangeshkar, Manna De and Kishore Kumar to contemporary hits from YoYo Honey Singh, Badshah, Armaan Mallik and more. “The food at the lounge will reflect the evolution of music from raagas to rap, and we are delighted to bring this new concept to Pune, the land of poet saints and music maestros. Being a food and beverage company, we are committed to help our brethren farmers alleviate problems arising from water scarcity in the state, which impacts their livelihood and food supply. The company will present a special Love, Serve, Care concert that will help raise funds for this shortly as this is an immediate need,” concluded Christina. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Girl, brother drown in Ghod river.description: PUNE: A girl (14) and her 10-year-old brother drowned in Ghod river at Vadgaon (Kashinbeg) in Ambegaon taluka, about 90km from the city, on Saturday. The Manchar police identified the deceased duo as Kajal Vijay Pawar and Vijay. They had gone to the river to wash clothes with their two siblings. Their parents had gone to the Chakan market when they had gone to the river. Their two siblings, accompanying them, raised an alarm when the duo fell in water. Villagers rushed to the site and jumped into water to rescue the duo. Both were motionless when they were taken out of water. They were rushed to a nearby hospital, where doctors pronounced them dead. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Technology glitches continue despite shi.description: PUNE: The anticipation of a hassle-free property registration process following the department’s announcement of the shift to the cloud technology continues to be on paper with no end to the queues and chaos at its offices. The department had shifted to the cloud technology to beat server snags earlier this year. Initially, some changes in the government receipt accounting system (GRAS) servers had hampered the registration process. Now, the changes in the land record servers are slowing down the process, senior registration department officials said. The Inspector General of Registration and Stamps (IGR) department had earlier this year uploaded its 150TB data on to the cloud to ensure a snag-free service at its property registration offices. IGR officials said the changes made in the web security services of the finance and land records departments have developed glitches, leading to the delay in the work. An official said, “These troubles will be ironed out once all the departments, particularly that of land and finance, are integrated with the registration department. Whenever there’s a change in the functioning of these departments, it slows down the servers. As a result, the overall registration process slows down.” The official said the land record servers, that have already migrated to the cloud technology, were slowing down the overall registration process as the 7/12 extract data are not getting immediately reflected. Earlier, changes in the GRAS servers, which generate challans, could not be accessed by the registration department. The department had a few months ago sought a standard operating procedure (SOP) for all departments and their integration with the registration offices to avoid such a situation. “However, it is yet to happen,” the official said. Earlier, the finance department had made some changes in its web security certificate, which affected the web service programmes and hampered the registration work. Citizens said the department must ensure proper communications to reduce their inconveniences. Advocate Amitabh Mehta, who has raised the issue of the frequent technical snags with the property registration department, said almost all its offices were facing some issues despite the shift to cloud. He said the outstation citizens were the worst hit, as they have come to the city for the registration. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Leopard sighted for second time near NDA.description: PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: For the second time this year, a leopard was spotted near the NDA campus at Kondhwe Dhavde village on Thursday night. Forest officials went to the spot and confirmed that the pugmarks were that of a leopard. The sighting of the leopard has created panic in the area. Deepak Pawar, range forest officer (RFO), Bhamburda range, said, “The leopard was sighted by villagers on an agriculture field behind Hotel Peacock. The animal crossed a stream and went towards the NDA campus. A team of forest officials went to the village today on the directives of assistant conservator Mahesh Bhavsar.” Kondhwe Dhavde village is located along Mutha river, near the NDA campus. Nitin Dhavde, village sarpanch, said, “The leopard was sighted behind Hotel Peacock on an agricultural field belonging to owner Bhagwan More on Thursday night. Forest department officials visited the village on Friday after the villagers demanded that a cage be installed in the area to catch the leopard.” Dhavde said that the leopard was sighted in the village for the first time. Bhagwan More, owner of Hotel Peacock, said, “Some customers at the hotel as well as my cousin saw the leopard sprinting on the road. I was some distance away from them. We checked the CCTV footage and found that it was indeed a leopard.” More added, “The leopard was sighted again in the morning, around 8am, on Friday by people who went for a morning walk in the open area near the NDA campus on the fields near our hotel. It was again sighted on the Mutha riverbed near the dam wall around 3 pm.” “There is very little human settlement in the area near our hotel as there are only open fields near the NDA campus. This area is located around 1 km from the gaothan area. So, we feel the leopard must have strayed into the desolate area,” he said. The sighting of leopard has impacted the daily lives of villagers. “The number of people going for morning walk has reduced. Farmers are scared to go alone to their fields for agricultural work,” said More. In January this year, a leopard was sighted near Ahire village, inside the NDA campus in Khadakwasle, which created panic among residents in the area. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Civic body razes wall between two societ.description: PUNE: The civic administration has demolished a 120ft compound wall, constructed without any permission in 1997, between two housing societies in Bhavani Peth. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Wednesday razed the wall after the Supreme Court dismissed a special leave petition (SLP) filed by the Kumar Galaxy Co-Operative Housing Society on June 10. An SC division bench comprising Justice Indira Banerjee and Ajay Rastogi in its order observed,“We find no ground to interfere with the impugned order passed by the high court in exercise of jurisdiction under Article 136 of the Constitution. The SLP is accordingly dismissed. As a sequel to the above, pending interlocutory applications also stand disposed of.” It added, “Needless to mention that in the event any alternative proposal including the application for sub-division if any is submitted by the petitioner, the same may be considered by the municipal authorities in accordance with law. However, this shall not be construed as any restriction on demolition of wall now in existence as the same is without any sanction from the municipal authorities.” Kumar Galaxy ‘E’ society chairman Prakash Hande told TOI,“The PMC demolished 70% of the wall on June 12. The remaining 30% could not be demolished as the residents of Kumar Galaxy had launched an agitation and created obstacles for the demolition squad.” “We took help of the tapid action force because some citizens opposed the action that was carried out following the court’s order,” PMC executive engineer Jayant Sarvade said. The HC bench had upheld two orders of a trial court and an appeal court (both in Pune) of August 4, 2014, and February 12, 2015, respectively, rejecting an interim relief to protect the wall. The Kumar Galaxy society moved the high court after it failed to get relief from the civil court. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Police raid 6 pubs, seize liquor worth R.description: PUNE: For the second straight night, officers from the Pune police crime branch raided six pubs and restaurants for playing loud music and serving liquor illegally. The police carried out the drive between midnight and 2.30am on Baner Road, Yerawada and Bund Garden Road and seized liquor worth Rs4.51 lakh. The team comprised assistant commissioner of police (crime) Bhanupratap Barge, assistant police inspector Ashwini Jagtap, sub-inspector Satish Walke, and constables Sunil Pawar, Shankar Sampate, Mauli Pawar and others. According to the norms, playing loud music in public places is illegal after 10.30pm. Barge said that all these places were found playing loud music, well above the prescribed decibel levels, at the time. Initially, police raided four restaurants and pubs in the Bund Garden Road area. These commercial establishments were found playing loud music. Cases against these establishments have been filed at the Bund Garden police station, officers said. Following this, the team raided a pub located in Yerawada, where they found the establishment selling serving liquor illegally to its patrons. The police seized 49 bottle of liquor worth Rs1.01 lakh from the spot. A case against the pub has been filed at the Yerawada police station. Later, the police raided a pub-cum-lounge on Baner Road, around 2.30am. There too, the police discovered the establishment playing loud music as well as was serving liquor illegally. They then seized bottles of liquor worth Rs3.50 lakh and registered a case against the pub’s management at the Chatushrungi police station. ACP Barge said police will continue to raid such establishments if they are violating norms and not adhering to the 10.30pm deadline curbing the use of loudspeakers. “They must adhere to the rules,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Electric AC buses to ply from Mumbai to.description: MUMBAI: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has floated tenders, inviting bids to procure e-buses on wet lease. Sources said that the corporation is likely to procure a total of 100 airconditioned e-buses by the end of the year. The managing director of MSRTC, Ranjit Singh Deol, said: “We are keen to run these airconditioned e-buses, which will be on several intercity routes across Maharashtra - few of them being Mumbai-Pune and Pune-Nashik corridors.” These buses will have special charging stations set up at MSRTC depots. Sources said the state government was also setting up e-charging stations along the Mumbai-Pune Expressway and at other prominent state highways. The state run power utility firm MSEDCL has been roped in to provide the charging points at their substations and offices located close to highways. Six such stations are planned on Pune Expressway. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pune: Biker injured after tree branch fa.description: PUNE: A 26-year-old mechanical engineer was severely injured after a branch of a eucalyptus (Nilgiri) tree fell on him while he was riding his motorcycle off the NIBM Road on Sunday evening. Five other vehicles, including two SUVs, were also damaged in the incident. Ashraf Jalal Pathan, the injured engineer from Prithvi Park, is undergoing treatment in the intensive care unit at the Ruby Hall Clinic in Wanowrie. The incident highlights the need for the civic body to identity trees in dangerous conditions and chop/trim them before the monsoon sets in to prevent such accidents. “Pathan sustained injuries on his head, right shoulder and right leg. He has been put on a ventilator and his condition is critical,” said his relative Aadib Shaikh. Shilpa Kulkarni, an intensivist at the Ruby Hall Clinic, confirmed: “He has a severe traumatic brain injury. He has also sustained grievous chest injury and has fractured his thigh bone. His condition is critical and he is on a ventilator support.” “When the branch was falling, a motorcycle rider came at a high speed. I tried to stop him, but failed,” eyewitness Tai Murlidhar Ingle, from Kondhwa, told TOI. Ingle added, “The branch fell on his head and he was not wearing a helmet. I was terrified when his blood started oozing out.” The eucalyptus tree is located on the premises of Vidarbha Cooperative society no. 2, off NIBN Road. Its branch fell on the opposite side — on the premises of Kwality Garden society. A compound wall of the society was also damaged. Residents of the Kwality Garden society said the branches of the tree had become dangerous. “We had written several letters to the other society, requesting the members to trim the branches. However, we did not receive any response,” a resident said. Anuradha Kapade, the secretary of Vidarbha Cooperative society no. 2, told TOI that the tree was not on the premises of their society, but instead was on the premises of the Vidarbha Cooperative society no. 1. “We will take up the matter with the local corporator,” Kapade said. However, Vijay Lonare, the office bearer of the Vidarbha Cooperative society no. 1, refuted this. Lonare said the tree was indeed on the premises of the society no. 2. “We have told the society to cut the branches,” Lonare said. Nanda Lonkar, the local corporator, said the PMC officials have said that an NOC from the owner is required to cut the branches of the trees on private properties. “If anyone comes across such trees, they should immediately contact the PMC,” Lonkar said. Puneites go on short weekend getaways to.description: PUNE: With the ICC Cricket World Cup entering its third week, more and more Puneites are opting for quick getaways to catch the high-octane on-field action. Travel operators have experienced a surge in demand for homestay villas and resorts in Lonavla, Panchgani, Mulshi, and Karjat, among others. Amit Damani, co-founder of Vista Rooms, said the demand for villas with home theatre systems has been especially high. “If those are sold out, we are setting up projectors,” Damani said, adding that guests really seemed to be enjoying these matches with friends and family. “Barbecues are also becoming a staple part of the fun,” he added. Damani further said Lonavla was the destination of choice for many. “Nearly 35% of our bookings in Lonavla during the India-Australia match were from Pune. We are gearing up for another intense weekend with the India-Pakistan this Sunday,” he said. Devendra Parulekar, founder of SaffronStays, said the monsoon also played a role. “Our villas in Karjat, Kamshet, Mulshi, Bhor and Lonavla are selling like hot cakes,” he said. “Consumers are turning weekends into ‘match parties’ and using this opportunity to spend time with their family and friends,” observed Rajeev Kale of Thomas Cook (India) Limited. “The world cup has prompted Puneites to align short weekend getaways with India’s match schedule,” said Daniel D’souza, president and country head (leisure), SOTC Travel, said. “While homestays provide a comfortable place to enjoy the sport together, resorts provide additional alternatives,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man booked for flashing ailing patient i.description: PUNE: A resident of Chinchwad was booked for flashing a woman admitted in a hospital, adjacent to the building he stays in, on Thursday afternoon. The 33-year-old patient of the private hospital in Chinchwad lodged a complaint with police on Friday. The complaint stated that the man had flashed her from his flat’s window on Thursday. A Chinchwad police officer said they had checked the building and the flat, but were unable to track down the man yet. The police said the hospital and residential building were close to each other. People standing in balconies or windows of houses in the building could look inside the windows and balconies of the hospital, and vice versa. The woman, admitted to the hospital for fever, was standing near the window when the man walked near his window and flashed her. The man also made obscene gestures at her and then shut his window. The woman reported the matter to the police. They are looking for the suspect, and they presume he is a middle-aged man. Autoricksaw driver harasses 21-year-old executiveAn autorickshaw driver flashed a 21-year-old executive working in a private company when she was walking home. Sub-inspector Rohit Divate of the Hinjewadi police said, “The woman was walking to her residence around 8.30pm. The area is isolated and dark. The road does not have street lights and CCTV cameras.” He said the driver tied a cloth around his face and started driving behind the woman. “He increased the vehicle’s speed when the woman stopped and then turned back. He went ahead for a few metres, got down from his vehicle, flashed her and fled,” he said. The woman, perturbed, ran towards her residence and raised an alarm. A group of men went to the spot but they did not find the vehicle or its driver there, Divate said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Seven survey consultants to be appointed.description: PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: A total of seven survey consultants would be appointed for the town planning department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation for a tenure of three years. “They will carry out surveys of land, development roads that need to fixed, road areas that need to be widened, flood lines and affected areas that need to be fixed, among others. They will also survey the land acquisition proposals submitted to the district collector, among others,” Rajendra Pawar, deputy director of the town planning department, said. The survey work would have to be carried out as per the Global Positioning System (GPS) and Google imagery. The civic body would have to ensure the redevelopment plan is prepared through local area plan and the urban expansion the through town planning scheme. It will also have to monitor the physical and financial process. The cost for providing urban infrastructure and amenities under such local area plans would have to be financed through value capture financing tools, such as betterment charges and sale of reserved plots. Demonetised and fake notes deposited.description: PUNE: Police on Friday booked unidentified person/s for depositing counterfeit currency notes with a face value of Rs 5.94 lakh at the Tilak Road branch of a public sector bank soon after the Centre announced demonetisation of Rs 1,000 and Rs 500 currency notes in November 2016. Bank officer Rohankumar Singh (38) of Baner has lodged a complaint. Senior inspector Ashok Kadam of the Swargate police told TOI, “The deposit was made soon after the demonetisation was announced and could not be detected earlier as there was a huge rush of depositors. Though the bank has the mechanism to check counterfeit notes, the officials failed to identify them then.” Kadam said the bank had sent all the currency notes to the Reserve Bank of India, which found that the notes were counterfeit and directed the bank to lodge an FIR. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Monsoon\u2019s arrival in Maharashtra on.description: PUNE: Monsoon currents might have reached parts of Maharashtra, but the India Meteorological Department (IMD) cannot declare an onset until there is a smooth distribution of rainfall over land areas and until the monsoon covers parts of peninsular India. The wind pattern over parts of southern Maharashtra has already changed to westerly, with rainfall in several locations and heavy showers in isolated areas. But the monsoon appears to be weak in the south, as its progress has slowed down due to weak rainfall activity over Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. As a result, the progress of the northern limit of monsoon has been hampered towards the eastern coast, while the conditions are favourable towards the west coast. IMD officials, however, said the monsoon could strengthen in the next three or four days and cover all of Maharashtra by June 24 — June 25 at the latest — around 12 days later than the normal onset date. Monsoon normally covers most of Maharashtra by around June 12. Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD-Pune, told TOI that there was no progress in the monsoon on Saturday, with its northern limit still over Mangalore, Mysore, Salem, Cuddalore, Agartala, Lumding, and Passighat. “Currently, though conditions seem favourable over parts of south Maharashtra, Konkan and Goa, we cannot declare an onset. This region has been getting good rainfall due to the wind pattern (here becoming westerly) and the presence of an offshore trough, resulting in continuous rains in the windward side of the Sahyadri range. But the monsoon has been weak over parts of the south peninsular India, including south interior Karnataka, north interior Karnataka, Rayalaseema and Coastal Andhra (in Andhra Pradesh) and Telangana,” he said. To maintain the monsoon’s spatial continuity, Kashyapi said, the onset over parts of south Maharashtra and Konkan still cannot be declared, as the monsoon will first have to cover parts of south peninsular India. “Whatever moisture was there over these regions was depleted by the very severe cyclonic storm, Vayu. That is why the monsoon’s advance over parts of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and the rest of Tamil Nadu is becoming a problem. So technically, the monsoon’s onset over parts of Maharashtra still cannot be declared, as the monsoon needs to proceed in a uniform manner,” he said. Kashyapi said that the monsoon vortex is likely to strengthen over the Bay of Bengal in three to four days. “In another two days, the monsoon may further progress over northeast India and may cover most of that region by three to four days. We expect the formation of a low pressure system over the Bay of Bengal in a few days, which will strengthen the Bay of Bengal branch of the monsoon over Coastal Andhra. Thus, going by this, monsoon may enter extreme southern parts of Maharashtra by June 20 at the latest,” said Kashyapi. This way, the monsoon may cover the whole of Maharashtra, including Pune, by June 25 at the latest. “By then, even Vidarbha and Marathwada will get good spells of rain. However, due to the delayed onset of monsoon over Kerala and Vayu, the cumulative June rainfall for Maharashtra as well as India as a whole may still be below normal,” said Kashyapi.
